alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 9:03AM EDT until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until noon EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms Southern and Central Biscayne Bay moving westward. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen over this area from earlier thunderstorms from yesterday and overnight. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with the new area of showers and thunderstorms moving into the area from the east. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Homestead, Coral Gables, South Miami, Black Point, Kendall, Homestead Miami Speedway, The Redland, Pinecrest, Florida City, West Perrine, Cutler Bay, Goulds, Zoo Miami, Richmond Heights, Palmetto Bay, Princeton, Richmond West, Country Walk and Naranja. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
